content: What's the difference in autumn weather between Moscow and New York City?

Autumn weather in Moscow and New York City can vary due to differences in latitude, altitude, and local climate patterns. Generally, both cities experience cooler temperatures and changing leaves during this season.

In Moscow, autumn typically begins in September and lasts through November. The weather starts off mild, with temperatures averaging around 10-15°C (50-59°F) in September, but it rapidly cools down, especially towards November, when temperatures can drop to around 0-5°C (32-41°F). Moscow is known for its unpredictable weather, and sudden cold snaps are not uncommon.

New York City, on the other hand, has a more moderate climate. Autumn in NYC starts in September and ends in November. September is usually mild, with temperatures ranging from 15-25°C (59-77°F), and it gradually cools down to around 7-15°C (45-59°F) in November. New York is also prone to occasional rain and storms during this season.

In summary, while both cities experience a transition from warm to cool temperatures in autumn, Moscow tends to get colder faster and reaches lower temperatures compared to New York City.
